sidebar.body_text: Howdy! I'm a Software Engineer currently with Audible, based out of Seattle, Washington. I love working in a field that lets me constantly learn and grow, and apply that knowledge to solve real-world problems for people. Let's build solutions together!

main_feed.text: Born and raised in Dallas, Texas, I graduated from The University of Texas at Dallas in 2013 with a double major of Computer Science and Arts and Technology (with a focus on video game design). I've always been interested in the intersection of technology and design, and on creating software which is built with real human workflows in mind, software as a means to an end of allowing people to solve bigger problems and do more. Since then, I've worked at Capital One, Microsoft, and most recently at Audible trying to solve problems at an enterprise scale.

items.text: Devloping and maintaining an automated testing pipeline, leveraging Jenkins and AWS Device Farm to run, monitor, and report on tests for Audible's mobile apps

Designed and deployed features for internal tooling allowing the entire Azure organization to track and respond to KPI-based action items. Assisted in rollout of Azure systems to Qatar region for 2022 World Cup
Designed, deployed, and maintained a serverless CICD pipeline supporting dev teams across the Financial Services org. Supported front- and back-end for Auto Refinance page
A web-based media collection database system built in React atop a serverless Flask API and SQLite, designed to help manage a large collection of physical media.
A website built in React for players returning to the tabletop game Magic: The Gathering, helping players to catch up on changes to the game since they last played.
A React page built to help Spanish learners practice their verb conjugation, allowing them to learn vocabulary and practice conjugation in various tenses and moods.
A serverless API built in Node.js that is capable of generating fake personal information for tabletop games, utilizing Claudia.js to deploy to AWS and consumed by Dockerized applications
